message:
Al Jazeera's Mike Hanna reports from Cairo:

The cabinet is meeting at the moment to discuss the present situation, we expect a statement from them later in the day.

The opinion in Egypt within itself is sharply divided, the broad umbrella body National Salvation front welcomed the action of the course past 24 hours saying that it was necessary to maintain the democracy.

However the anti-Coup alliance, which are opposed to interim government and its military backers absolutely insistent that what happened yesterday was a massacre.

Muslim Brotherhood will be holding marches and gatherings later on the day. Funerals of those are about to start in many parts of the country.

Those quotes from the followers of the Muslim Brotherhood for further demonstration gives rise to an increase tension which has been present.
